reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just bought this one because it was so cheap. I have to admit I didn't expect too much, but it kept me playing for a few hours. My opinion, after playing it, is that Bullshot is a real bargain.

The pros:
A lot of references and tributes to old arcade games and movies (You break a car like in 'Street Fighter', ride a bike like in 'Sly Spy', and in the trailer I saw you'll have to kill a heart like in 'Contra'. This can't be just coincidence. ).
Franky charging at the enemies. (Best melee attack ever!! XD )
Good gameplay.
Trading cards are awesome!! XD
Music (I really liked this one!!).
Less than 1$ (The price raised recently, it's still a cheap one, anyway).
Great developer support and the updates keep a good pace.

The cons:
It looks like it's a little short at this moment. Maybe it's not a real con, as developers say it will have 8 or 10 levels (it has 3 plus 3 bonus right now). (The game is frequently updated and developers are adding levels almost every week. It has 6 plus 3 bonus now).
Took a little to find out how to play (there's a help image showing the controls but it's hidden" in the options).
Difficulty is maybe too high at some points. I'm also not sure if it's really bad
date: as it makes Bullshot look more like the old arcade games.\nThe 'retro TV filter'. It looks funny for a while
recommended: but fortunately you can turn it off (and the game looks better without it)."
voteText: true

Greetings fellow gamers!
This is Gamer Guy (In a Suit) back with a review for another indie title. This afternoon I shall be bringing you, Bullshot.
Bullshot is a run-and-gun 2D shooter that is a throwback to classics like Contra.

It is actually LESS than a dollar. So

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A really fun game with a nice art style!
I really like how it starts up, reminding me of the old days.
The style is really nice too you can set it to look like an old tv or to hd. The overall style is also nice.
The gameplay is pretty good, the only complaints i have are:
1. The character walks a bit too slow for my liking (but maybe that's me).
2. The character jumps a second after i press space (but this can offcourse be fixed).
You have about ten levels and a bit of a story.
It's just a run and gun, but a really fun one
It's overall just a fun little game that has enough to offer for its price.

If you are thinking about buying it, you should its totally worth the price

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great run & gun action with fantastic developer support!
Fantastic 2D indie arcade shooter with some retro feeling to old contra.

This game will throw you back to classic run and gun games.

Best played with keyboard and mouse!

Pros

Cheap price!
Great retro style
Cool soundtrack!
Awesome localization
Funny story
Collectables
Trading cards
Fantastic developer support!
Cons

No ability to resume from checkpoint when quitting game (have to run whole level from start)
Some bugs (like gun is pointing sometime in wrong direction etc.)

Conclusion: With small price and so good developer support this game is pure gold. This game will live strong long time!

Hardware        Type                Motherboard        ASUSTeK P8H67              GPU        Nvidia GTX 560                OS        Windows 10 pro 64bit            CPU        Intel i5 2500K            RAM        8GB DDR3             HDD        500gb HDD                Mouse        Logitech g502

Early Access Review

This game is really going for a retro-style DooM look and feel, but in 2.5D.

It's great that the developer has actively listened to suggestions, for instance, I suggested that we be able to jump off ladders, the next day, it was added. Overall it's pretty great to see the game develop.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very solid side scroller which reminds me greatly of Contra and the original DukeNukem. The graphical options are cute and gameplay is fairly typical of traidtional side scrollers--with mouse aiming. Play is fun, though there is a limitation in the raw number of levels-but then it is still an early access release.

My greatest complaint" is the jump mechanic. I find the game is vertically unforgiving
date: with some areas being missed if one drops too low too quickly.\n\nThe collectable mechanic is typical of many side-scrollers
recommended: though I have found some "wall clipping" issues (the sewer level for one turtle for example) which have forced a restart of the level--though the collectable was still counted.\n\nMid-level save flags
voteText: are helpful
votesHelpful: all stockpiled weapons are typically deleted--which can make for some difficulties if the level is new to the player.\n\nWeapon options are still thin
votesTotal: with 4 primary weapons available (Unlimited ammo base machine gun
column16:
grenade launcher). Ammunition is very limited for the flamer and rocket launcher (the weapons I've also found have the least utility unless opening a wall etc.) The nade launcher was useful for blowing open some floors and vs. a particular boss but otherwise I've found the best utility from the starter machine gun. Some additional development to make the lesser used weapons more viable is hopefully on the horizon.

Levels are generally well designed and fun--if you enjoy the side scrolling format. The "hide in the shadows" element can be useful and the bull charge is fun.

Boss mechanics are generally well done
column17: with identifiable patterns if one is paying attention.\n\nOverall
column18: this is an enjoyable "time-waster" with a limited backstory and a fair bit of humour with references to other games and shows/movies."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Bullshot is fantastic 2D shoot 'em up with retro style in Early Access.

Iv'e met the game while I was visiting my grandmother, it showed as reccomended for me.
Many poeple make game on Steam are good, but they have their own price. There are also games that came from Greenlight and their sold for 1$ and I have question have did they get passed. But Bullshot, is diffrent.
It's cheap for it's own price. Costs 1$ and offers much more content then any game for the same price or even higher. Sadly, it's current price in Early Access, After realese the game will cost 5-7$. But I think it's worth it. Buy it now so you don't have to buy it for higher price.

But more about the game it self.
Pros
-Great Gameplay.
-Good graphics
-Retro style, plus you can change for, VHS Black 'n white and others. You can feel the nostalgia in this game, and it's good
nostalgia.
-Price in Early Access.
-Gamepad support.
-Good OST
-You can play this game in many diffrent languages. For example:
Polish, French, Deustch and many others.
-Achievements
-Steam Cloud
-It downloads quick (For me it's plus)
-Cards


Cons
-Level build.
-Bugs
-Not many levels
-Early Access
-Price in full realese
-You can easly die.
-Collision
Edit:-You can finish the game in less than 2 hours :(

Final score 9/10
Don't wait for the full realese, buy it now. So you don't have to pay x5/x7 more.
Totaly Reccomended!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What we have? Another game in old school style. The look of game, music and same retro game mechanics is great, but gameplay is awful and story… truly saying there is no story. So many times I was buried in textures. The worst is when the level is near to end and it happens. Sometimes in such dead zones without exit I found game objects, so maybe it was idea in it. Next minus is amount of levels, why so few? I played about 2 hours and it is  more then 3/2 of game. Achievements almost all in first location.
Can I recomend this game? I think the answer is yes. Because it is realy cheap and game worth the money, but only for people who older then 20.
Think twise.
